Pre-Game Insights: India and Pakistan are playing in New York for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. This is the 19th match of Group A.
India has a better form guide, having won all their last five completed matches, while Pakistan has lost three and won two.
Pakistan's poor start in the USA adds context to this game, as they are facing the possibility of being eliminated if they lose.
India has been based in New York since they landed in the USA, while Pakistan only arrived in New York before sunrise on Friday.
The pitch and conditions are expected to favor fast bowlers, with Shaheen Afridi, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Amir, Haris Rauf, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj, and Arshdeep Singh lining up for both teams.
Pitch and Conditions: The quality of drop-in pitches in New York has been substandard, with unpredictable bounce, exaggerated seam movement, and a slow outfield making run-scoring extremely difficult.
Fast bowlers have dominated the games so far in New York.
Some weather websites have forecast showers for Sunday morning.
In the Spotlight: Babar Azam's leadership could come under scrutiny if Pakistan loses to India.
Shivam Dube, who was picked in the Indian XI primarily as a left-hand disruptor of spin in the middle overs, will face a test against Pakistan's fast bowlers.
Stats and Trivia: In the first four T20 World Cup matches played in New York, fast bowlers have taken 45 wickets and spinners only 10.
Babar scored a match-winning 68 off 52 balls against India in Dubai in the 2021 T20 World Cup, but was dismissed for a golden duck by Arshdeep Singh in Melbourne in 2022.
Virat Kohli has never been dismissed by Naseem, Amir, Rauf, and Shadab in T20Is, and has a strike rate of 154 against Afridi.
